intro: Cynoglossum gussonei, commonly known as the Gussone's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves that resemble mouse ears. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cynoglossum gussonei is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers.
